issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
running a GET on the scheduler web services rest api (RM:port/ws/cluster/scheduler) with the FifoScheduler configured with no nodemanagers up yet and it prints out invalid json of NaN for the used Capacity:

{"scheduler":{"schedulerInfo":{"type":"fifoScheduler","capacity":1.0,"usedCapacity":NaN,"qstate":"RUNNING","minQueueMemoryCapacity":1024,"maxQueueMemoryCapacity":10240,"numNodes":0,"usedNodeCapacity":0,"availNodeCapacity":0,"totalNodeCapacity":0,"numContainers":0}}}
fields.summary: FifoScheduler web service rest API can print out invalid JSON

comments.body:
-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12513756/MAPREDUCE-3680.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 3 new or modified tests.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    -1 core tests.  The patch failed these unit tests:
                  org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.resourcemanager.webapp.TestRMWebServices

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1823//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1823//console

This message is automatically generated.

Hey B Anil Kumar, 

Thanks for the patch.  It looks good other then the test failures. Can you update TestRMWebServices (function verifyClusterSchedulerFifoGeneric) to expect 0 instead of the NaN now?  

A very minor nit if you want to fix is Scheduler is misspelled in the test function title: testFifoSchedularCapacityWhenNoNMs



As a side note this also fixes the mapred queue -info output:

with patch:
$ mapred queue -info default
======================
Queue Name : default 
Queue State : running 
Scheduling Info : Capacity: 100.0, MaximumCapacity: 1.0, CurrentCapacity: 0.0 


without:
$ mapred queue -info default
======================
Queue Name : default 
Queue State : running 
Scheduling Info : Capacity: 100.0, MaximumCapacity: 1.0, CurrentCapacity: NaN

Thanks for the inputs Thomas.

I am unable to cancel my previous patch. Attaching new patch.

Please review.

+1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12513949/MAPREDUCE-3680-1.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    +1 core tests.  The patch passed unit tests in .

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1829//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1829//console

This message is automatically generated.
